urlText: Major Event Buses operating for Bledisloe Cup Test at Olympic Park
content:
Saturday 21 September
 
From 12pm to 6.30pm, Sydney Olympic Park Major Event Buses will run for the Bledisloe Cup Test at Accor Stadium.
 
Travel on Major Event Buses is included in the cost of your event ticket. Attendees do not need to tap on and off, simply show your match ticket to the driver when boarding buses.
 
Buses run every 5 to 18 minutes, subject to traffic conditions.
 
For more information visit the Bledisloe Cup Test event page.
subtitle: Major Event Buses operating for Bledisloe Cup Test at Olympic Park

urlText: Changes to M92 Parramatta to Sutherland bus route
content:
From Sunday 24 September, route M92 Parramatta to Sutherland will be split into two new routes:
  • 920 Parramatta-Bankstown
  • 960 Bankstown-Sutherland
Passengers travelling the full length of the route (Parramatta to Sutherland), will need to change buses at Bankstown.
  • 920 services depart from Bankstown Station Stand E
  • 960 services depart from Bankstown Station Stand B
All other stops remain the same.
 
For more information see the news story.
 
This change will improve journey time and reliability for passengers and will allow drivers to complete other routes impacted by driver shortages.
 
Plan your trip with Trip Planner or transport apps before you travel.
subtitle: Changes to M92 Parramatta to Sutherland bus route

urlText: Sydney Olympic Park bus diversions for major events
content:
From 1.30am until 11.30pm on Saturday 21 September, route 525 and 526 services will be diverting while roads are closed in Sydney Olympic Park for the Bledisloe Cup on Saturday 21 September.
 
Services in both directions will be diverting via Edwin Flack Ave, Sarah Durack Ave and Australia Ave, and will miss stops on Dawn Fraser Ave and Park St. Catch these services from the stop on Park St at Olympic Park train station or other alternative stop locations on Edwin Flack Ave.
 
Allow extra time and check signs at stops for alternate stop locations.
 
Visit the Bledisloe Cup Test event page for more details.
 
Closed stops
  • Park Street opposite Olympic Park Station (Stop ID 212790)
    • Alternate stop: Olympic Park Station, Park Street (Stop ID 212712)
  • Dawn Fraser Avenue opposite Olympic Park Station (Stop ID 212791)
    • Alternate stop: Olympic Park Station, Park Street (Stop ID 212712)
  • Dawn Fraser Avenue before Edwin Flack Avenue (Stop ID 212788)
    • Alternate stop: Edwin Flack Avenue opposite Accor Stadium (Stop ID 212735)
  • Dawn Fraser Avenue after Edwin Flack Avenue (Stop ID 212787)
    • Alternate stop for route 526 only: Sydney Olympic Park Athletic Centre, Edwin Flack Ave (Stop ID 212733)
    • Alternate stop for route 525 only: Accor Stadium, Edwin Flack Avenue (Stop ID 212736)
  • Olympic Park Station, Dawn Fraser Avenue (Stop ID 212792)
    • Alternate stop: Olympic Park Station, Park Street (Stop ID 212712)
subtitle: Sydney Olympic Park bus diversions for major events

urlText: Temporary bus service changes in Sydney's South and South West
content:
In response to industry-wide driver shortages that are being experienced acutely by U-Go Mobility, Transport for NSW has approved temporary timetable adjustments to bus services in Sydney’s south and southwest.
 
For more information see the news story.
 
Please plan your trip or use trip planning apps each day before making your journey to get the latest information.

urlText: Trains will not stop at Wolli Creek, but make an extra stop at Arncliffe
content:
Monday 16 to Thursday 19 September  
  • Nightly from 9.50pm to 1.30am, trains will not stop at Wolli Creek, but make an extra stop at Arncliffe.
  • Buses run between Sydenham, Wolli Creek and Arncliffe.
  • Change at Arncliffe or Sydenham for a bus to Wolli Creek.
  • T8 Airport & South Line trains continue to stop at Wolli Creek.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
34T4 Wolli Creek to Sydenham and return
35T4 Wolli Creek to Arncliffe and return

urlText: Dulwich Hill bus diversions for Dulwich Hill Festival
content:
From 3am to 9pm on Sunday 29 September, buses will be diverting around a section of Marrickville Road and missing stops due to road closures for the Dulwich Hill Festival event.
 
Services will divert via Wardell Road, Frazer Street and New Canterbury Road.
 
Services travelling towards Dulwich Hill or Burwood will start and end their trips at Dulwich Hill Shops, New Canterbury Rd (Stop ID 220354).
 
Services travelling away from Dulwich Hill or Burwood will start and end their trips at Dulwich Hill Shops, New Canterbury Rd (Stop ID 220350).
 
Check signs at stops for alternative stop locations and allow extra travel time.
 
Missed stops
  • Dulwich Hill Shops, Marrickville Rd (Stop ID 220317)
  • Marrickville Rd at Fairfowl St (Stop ID 220339)
  • Marrickville Rd before Wardell Rd (Stop ID 220340)
  • Marrickville Rd opp Fairfowl St (Stop ID 220341)
  • Dulwich Hill Shops, Marrickville Rd (Stop ID 220342)

urlText: South Mosman Wharf: Route 111 temporary bus changes
content:
From Monday 5 August to Monday 16 September, from 6am to 4pm, Monday to Friday, there will be temporary changes to the Route 111 bus service due to construction work at South Mosman Wharf.

During this six-week period, buses will turn around on Raglan Street at the Musgrave Street intersection on weekdays from 6am-4pm only. Buses will run their usual routes on weekday afternoons, weeknights, and throughout the weekend. Private vehicles will still have full access to Musgrave Street.
  • Catch the Route 111 bus towards Military Road at the bus stop on Raglan Street at Musgrave Street (ID 2088154).
  • School buses will allow students to exit at this stop, avoiding the need to cross Raglan Street unattended.
  • Please note travel apps may not reflect these temporary changes.
Wharf closure:
  • South Mosman Wharf will be closed for around eight months to improve accessibility as part of the Safe Accessible Transport program.
  • Ferry passengers must use alternative transport options during the closure.
Alternative transport options:
  • Ferry services from Mosman Bay Wharf will continue as usual.
  • To get to Mosman Bay Wharf, catch the Route 111 bus service to Canrobert Street and change to the Route 230 bus from Avenue Road, a short walk away.
    230 bus services can also be used to connect to North Sydney and other destinations.
  • Please allow extra travel time and plan ahead using the Trip Planner.
subtitle: South Mosman Wharf: Route 111 temporary bus changes

properties.smsText: South Mosman Wharf: Route 111 temporary bus changes
properties.speechText:
From Monday 5 August to Monday 16 September, from 6am to 4pm, Monday to Friday, there will be temporary changes to the Route 111 bus service due to construction work at South Mosman Wharf.

During this six-week period, buses will turn around on Raglan Street at the Musgrave Street intersection on weekdays from 6am-4pm only. Buses will run their usual routes on weekday afternoons, weeknights, and throughout the weekend. Private vehicles will still have full access to Musgrave Street.

Catch the Route 111 bus towards Military Road at the bus stop on Raglan Street at Musgrave Street (ID 2088154).

School buses will allow students to exit at this stop, avoiding the need to cross Raglan Street unattended.
 
Please note travel apps may not reflect these temporary changes.
 
South Mosman Wharf will be closed for around eight months to improve accessibility as part of the Safe Accessible Transport program. Ferry passengers must use alternative transport options during the closure.

urlText: Greenwich Point Wharf closed
content:
Monday 22 April until late 2024
 
Greenwich Point Wharf is being upgraded and will be closed to the public for around eight months, weather and site conditions permitting. Ferry passengers will need to use alternative transport during the wharf closure:
  • Use the existing 265 bus route which travels from Lane Cove to North Sydney via Greenwich, connecting with St Leonards and North Sydney train stations.
  • Additional bus services for the 265 route will be provided between Greenwich Point Wharf and Crows Nest, via St Leonards during weekdays and nights and over the weekends to offset the missing ferry services.
  • Captain Cook Cruises operates a commuter ferry service during peak travel times from Greenwich Wharf Bay Street. Please check their website for more information.
  • Allow extra travel time, listen to announcements and check information displays for service updates.
  • For more information on the Greenwich Point Wharf Upgrade please visit the Greenwich Point Wharf Upgrade page.
subtitle: Greenwich Point Wharf closed

properties.speechText:

Ferries will not stop at Greenwich Point Wharf during the closure.

urlText: South Mosman Wharf closed for upgrades
content:
Monday 3 June until late 2024

South Mosman Wharf is being upgraded and will be closed to the public for around eight months, weather and site conditions permitting. Ferry passengers will need to use alternative transport during the wharf closure:

  • Public transport options include F2 and F6 ferry services from Mosman Bay Wharf.
  • Use the existing 111 bus service from Musgrave Street to Canrobert Street and change to the 230 bus from Avenue Road to Mosman Bay Wharf.
  • The 230 bus service from Military Road can also be used to connect to North Sydney and other destinations.
  • Allow extra travel time, listen to announcements, and check information displays for service updates.
subtitle: South Mosman Wharf closed for upgrades

properties.smsText: South Mosman Wharf closed for upgrades
properties.speechText:
From Monday 3rd June until late 2024, South Mosman Wharf is being upgraded and will be closed to the public for around eight months, weather and site conditions permitting. Ferry passengers will need to use alternative transport during the wharf closure:

Public transport options include F 2 and F 6 ferry services from Mosman Bay Wharf.
Use the existing 1 1 1 bus service from Musgrave Street to Canrobert Street and change to the 230 bus from Avenue Road to Mosman Bay Wharf.
The 2 3 0 bus service from Military Road can also be used to connect to North Sydney and other destinations.
Allow extra travel time, listen to announcements, and check information displays for service updates.
